item.title: Short meditative archery game Many Nights a Whisper announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/short-meditative-archery-game-many-nights-a-whisper-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Deconstructeam and Selkie Harbour-developed title due out this spring.

Developers Deconstructeam and Selkie Harbour have announced Many Nights a Whisper, a meditative third-person archery game where the player must take part in a ritual that determines the fate of your people. It will launch for PC via Steam this spring.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A short interactive essay on dreams, pressure, and expectations. Take part in an ancient ritual where one shot determines the fate of a generation.

Ten years ago, you were chosen to perform a ritual.

Many Nights a Whisper is a meditative third-person archery game. Under the gentle guidance of your mentor, you will train to land an impossibly distant shot. Practice tirelessly, honing your skill for the sacred ceremony that will shape the future of your people. Succeed, and their wishes will come true, bringing a decade of prosperity. Should you fail, ten years of calamity will follow, and their hopes will be lost to the winds.

Ah, and you only have one shot.

No pressure.

Key Features

  • Short and Thought-Provoking – Playtime: 50 to 75 minutes. Delve into the routine of the Dreamer, the person chosen to perform this critical ceremony. Engage with your mentor in warm and intimate discussions. Listen to the townsfolk at the Confession Wall, weigh their whispers, and decide whether to grant their wishes.
  • Test Your Marksmanship – Master the sacred slingshot, a mystical device strung with human hair. Carefully aim, adjust for distance, and land fireballs into ancient chalices scattered across a ruin-sewn archipelago.
  • Dreamy Soundscape – Immerse yourself in the soothing sounds of the Mediterranean Sea, accompanied by a mesmerizing soundtrack composed by fingerspit.
  • Magical Environment – Enjoy a distinctive art direction through low-poly 3d and vibrant pixel-art textures—a relaxing yet melancholic archipelago filled with imagery inspired by Iberian culture.

item.title: ZA/UM announces “genre-defining” espionage RPG PROJECT [C4]
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/za-um-announces-genre-defining-espionage-rpg-project-c4

Disco Elysium studio ZA/UM has announced PROJECT [C4], or its “next genre-defining RPG.”

“A mind-warping story of espionage and team-building in an original yet achingly familiar setting,” reads the teaser trailer description. “Get ready, operant.”

It is worth noting that while ZA/UM still retains the rights to Disco Elysium, several of its key staff have left to establish new studios and develop their own spiritual successors. This includes Longdue (Hopetown), Dark Math Games (XXX NIGHTSHIFT), and Summer Eternal.

item.title: Hopetown Kickstarter campaign launches March 17; teaser trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/hopetown-kickstarter-campaign-launches-march-17-teaser-trailer

More Disco Elysium veterans join the project.

The Kickstarter campaign for “psychogeographic” RPG Hopetown will launch on March 17, developer Longdue announced. A teaser trailer and new images were also released.

Additionally, Longdue announced that Disco Elysium narrator Lenval Brown will be closely involved in the project and voice a key character in the game, as teased in the trailer.

“It feels good to be back—to step into something new,” said Brown in a press release. “There’s nothing like bringing a world to life, shaping a story that’s been waiting to be spoken into existence.”

Martin Luiga, a founding member of the ZA/UM Cultural Association that developed Disco Elysium, as well as writer of the first short story in the Disco Elysium universe and of seven characters in the game, has also joined Longdue to work on Hopetown.

“I am pleased to share my experiences with Longdue to help them craft the narrative and systems for Hopetown, playing to the strengths that the narrative RPG genre has achieved thus far and attempting to innovate upon them to tell a rich story based in equal parts on what has been, what is and what could be,” said Martin. “I am confident that the team can deliver a worthy addition to the canon of Western RPGs. I call upon the fans of the RPG and adventure genre to back the Hopetown Kickstarter to help us make the game.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

As previously announced, Lenval and Martin are joined by Piotr Sobolewski, who oversaw a team of 15 that worked on Disco Elysium.

“At Longdue, we’ve built—and continue to build—a team with real horsepower: Disco Elysium contributors, AAA stalwarts, indie artisans—all champing at the bit to unleash their talents,” said Longdue narrative lead Grant Roberts. “Hopetown is what happens when you bring those minds together: a rich, reactive world, razor-sharp writing, and an RPG that purrs with depth and atmosphere.”

If you missed our previous coverage, read more about Hopetown here. More information will announced alongside the launch of the game’s Kickstarter campaign on March 17.
